content: the juliet hair ribbon an original pa4ern by morning coffee studios please note do not copy sell or distribute this pattern you may sell your finished product but please give pattern credit to morning coffee studios if you post your creations on instagram please tag me so i can see @morningcoffee studios original pa*ern by morning coffee studios abbreviations st stitch single_crochet single_crochet chain chain you will need co*on dk yarn you can use acrylic yarn if you wish i prefer co*on as it is lighter 4mm hook tapestry needle sntch markers scissors before you start wri*en using us terms worked in row back and forth unnl the edging which is worked along the side of the hair ne at the end of each row do not chain only turn unless otherwise directed this is what creates the diagonal edging original pa*ern by morning coffee studios the hair ribbon make a chain as long as you want your hair ne to be i recommend chaining at least 70 which is a good size for half-up/half-down dos or chain 90+ for longer nes for ponytails etc r1 single_crochet in the first chain from the hook single_crochet along r2-8 repeat r1 each row will reduce in number by 1 st do not fasten_off and move onto edging picture shows the edge of the hair ne decreasing with each row original pa*ern by morning coffee studios the edge e1 chain 1 and turn so you are working along the edge single_crochet in each st along 8 fasten_off and weave in ends e2 rea*ach yarn at corner sntch of opposite edge chain 1 single_crochet in each st along 8 fasten_off and weave in ends picture shows the finished edge with single_crochet in the side of each single_crochet of each row and you re done make sure to tag me in your pictures i d love to see what you create and follow me on instagram so you don t miss my next free pa*ern - @morningcoffee studios original pa*ern by morning coffee studios
